snippet: The e-mail to Rupert Murdoch’s son was deleted from his computer less than a week before the police opened their current investigation into phone hacking.
abstract: E-mail to Rupert Murdoch’s son James that was part of a chain of messages in 2008 warning of potential legal fallout from hacking at tabloid News of the World was deleted from his computer less than a week before the police opened their current investigation into phone hacking; intimations that the company may have purposely destroyed evidence raise questions about whether it may be investigated for obstruction of justice.
lead_paragraph: The e-mail to Rupert Murdoch’s son was deleted from his computer less than a week before the police opened their current investigation into phone hacking.

headline.seo: Hacking E-Mail Deleted From a Murdoch Computer, Lawyers Say
headline.main: E-Mail on ‘Rife’ Hacking Deleted From James Murdoch Computer, Lawyers Say
headline.print_headline: E-Mail Alert To a Murdoch On Hacking Was Deleted

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
